titleStmt.title: The song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the Lambe: opened in a sermon preached to the Honorable House of Commons, at their late solemne day of thanksgiving, Iune 15. 1643. for the discovery of a dangerous, desperate, and bloudy designe, tending to the utter subversion of the Parliament, and of the famous city of London. / By Stephen Marshall, B.D. and Pastor of Finchingfield in Essex. Published by order of that House.
titleStmt.author: Marshall, Stephen, 1594?-1655.

titleStmt.title: The song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the Lambe: opened in a sermon preached to the Honorable House of Commons, at their late solemne day of thanksgiving, Iune 15. 1643. for the discovery of a dangerous, desperate, and bloudy designe, tending to the utter subversion of the Parliament, and of the famous city of London. / By Stephen Marshall, B.D. and Pastor of Finchingfield in Essex. Published by order of that House.
titleStmt.author: Marshall, Stephen, 1594?-1655.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Sam: Man and Sam: Gellibrand in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: A sermon preached at the late Thanksgiving before the honorable House of Commons.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
